movie_title: Building a better world with wood? ⏲️ 6 Minute English
introduction: Did you know that being in nature, and building with wood, has benefits for our physical and mental

vocabulary.definition: the Japanese practice of 'forest bathing', which involves being calm and quiet amongst trees, using all your senses to observe nature, and breathing deeply for relaxation and health benefits
vocabulary.example: After a stressful week, I decided to try shinrin-yoku by taking a walk in the forest to unwind and recharge.
The speaker presented compelling evidence to support his argument for using wood as a sustainable building material.

vocabulary.definition: done in a way that shows intelligence and skill
vocabulary.example: The architect designed the eco-friendly building intelligently, using natural materials like bamboo and hemp.

vocabulary.definition: trees that are grown and used for building materials
vocabulary.example: The timber used in constructing the cabin was sourced sustainably from the nearby forest.

vocabulary.definition: a very tall, modern building typically found in urban areas
vocabulary.example: The city skyline was dominated by gleaming skyscrapers that reflected the sunlight.

vocabulary.definition: a family of plants used to make products like rope and strong cloth
vocabulary.example: The eco-conscious designer chose hemp fabric for the upholstery in the sustainable furniture collection.
